covered: POST payload validation: minimum required fields (TC01), full optional fields (TC02), and required header variations (TC03) covered.
Header validation and authorization: missing required header (TC04) and invalid header types (TC08) are tested; valid authentication path (TC09) covered.
Invalid payload handling: malformed JSON (TC05), empty payload (TC12), and missing required fields (TC06); input sanitization (XSS/injection) tested (TC15).
Schema robustness: extra/unknown fields are ignored (TC07).
Error handling: system dependency failure (TC10) and timeout (TC14) tested (503/504).
Boundary and data size: large payload (TC11).
Duplicate data handling: duplicate data scenarios (TC13).
Partial inputs and optional fields: partial input (TC16) and additional headers (TC17) covered.
Performance/concurrency: 1) concurrent requests (TC18) and 2) regression for field handling (TC19).
End-to-end validation: post-create retrieval via Location header and GET (TC20).
gaps: Rate limiting / throttling tests for multiple requests in short time (not covered).
Caching behavior validation beyond response content (e.g., ETag, Cache-Control headers) not covered.
403 Forbidden scenario (authorization with insufficient privileges) not explicitly tested (only 401 covered).
Generic 500 Internal Server Error scenarios (server-side failure not tied to dependency down) not explicitly tested.
recommendations: Add a dedicated 403 Forbidden test to cover insufficient privileges and access control paths.
Introduce rate-limiting/throttling tests to validate behavior under high load.
Add tests asserting caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) on POST (and possibly GET) responses.
Add a test simulating generic 500 Internal Server Error (unrelated to availability) to ensure proper server error handling and messaging.
Optionally add a focused test for isolated header validation (e.g., invalid token format) beyond the current header type test.
